content.description: Just Left of Duppy Conqueror. Shade till 2 pm then shaded by trees. This climb gets a little harder if you are shorter. (Some reachy moves). After you get to the top of this climb it is easy to set up a top rope for the Climb just right (Duppy Conqueror 5.11c)
content.protection: 7 or 8 bolts and lower off anchors

content.description: Just Left of Ambushed in the Night. See Mike Carville's 1991 guide book or the current topo on the main Emeralds page for information and location. Shade till noon then shaded by trees. This is one of the 3 original routes on the Kudos Kliff (Duppy conquer, Kudos and Ambushed in the night) put up by Mike Carville in 1989. The other routes on this wall were put up since 2005
content.protection: Bolts with lower off anchors at the top.

climbs.name: The Kreutzer
climbs.fa: First documented ascent by Chris Kreutzer, October 2015, with micro cams and petons

content.description: The first few moves, getting off the ground, can be a little bouldery, but the real crux is found just after the second bolt. There are a number of good side pulls and a few juggier holds throughout the route that are not easily seen, but come in handy in some of the thinner sections. All bolts can be clipped from a good clipping stance and should be within a reasonably easy reach for some of the shorter leaders. This route shares the anchor bolts with Get Out of I-ret.
content.protection: There are five bolts, all colored dark grey to blend in with the rock. All bolts should be easy to reach from a solid clipping stance, even for the shorter leaders.
content.location: This route ascends the obvious blocky arête between Kudos Left and Kudos Right. Rappel using the bolted anchor on Get Out of I-ret.

content.description: Just right of Ambushed in the Night. See Mike Carville's 1991 guide book or purchase the new North Tahoe guide for information and location. Shade till noon then shaded by trees. This is a rules problem climb. If you use the Arete you are cheating yourself

Just Left of Kudos. Shade till noon then shaded by trees. This is one of the 3 original routes on the Kudos Kliff (Duppy conquer, Kudos and Ambushed in the night) put up by Mike Carville in 1989. The other routes on this wall were put up since 2005. For easy top rope set up, climb "Step Into the Light" and move right 10' to anchors at top of "Duppy Conqueror"
content.protection: Bolts and lower off anchors. Bolts were recently added by permission of Mike Carville to make the climb less sporty. This climb was a Mike Carville climb from the late eighties. Originally the first bolt you see wasn't there and there were no bolts on the last third of the climb.

content.description: Just right of Kudos. See Mike Carville's 1991 guide book for information and location. Now, 7/2017 you can purchase the new North Tahoe guide for information. Shade till noon then shaded by trees. This is one of the 3 original routes on the Kudos Kliff (Duppy conquer, Kudos and Ambushed in the night) put up by Mike Carville in 1989. The other routes on this wall were put up since 2005
content.protection: Retro bolted 4/26/19 by original bolter, Mike Carville. Now 7 bolts. (as you climb this now,  think about how it was originally climbed with far fewer bolts and trad pro) Thanks to Mike, it is now climbable by the masses.
